subsection.continued: request the Board to review under this section the decision of the Authority or a censor under this Ordinance which resulted in the issue of the relevant certificate of exemption, certificate of approval, or certificate under section 15B(4)(b) or certificate under section 15K(5), as the case may be. (Replaced 74 of 1995 s. 21)

subsection.content: Where a request is made under subsection (1), the Secretary may, where appropriate, after taking into consideration the matters referred to in section 10(2), refer to the Board the decision to which that request relates. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Secretary shall only decline to refer a decision to the Board under subsection (2) if he is satisfied that the request to which the decision relates is made in a frivolous or vexatious manner. (Added 9 of 1999 s. 10)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: Where the Secretary declines, under subsection (2A), to refer a decision to the Board under subsection (2), he shall give to the person who made the request notice, in writing, of the fact that the decision has not been referred to the Board and the notice shall contain an adequate statement of the reasons why he is satisfied that the request to which the decision relates is made in a frivolous or vexatious manner. (Added 9 of 1999 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Where a request is made under subsection (1), the Secretary shall forthwith serve, personally or by registered post, on every concerned person and the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the notice under subsection (1) which makes that request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement informing such concerned person or the Authority, as the case may be, that he may, not later than 7 days after the service of that notice and statement, make written representations to the Board in respect of that request by delivering such representations to the Secretary at such place as is specified in that statement.

subsection.leadIn: Where, pursuant to a request made under subsection (1), the documents referred to in subsection (3)(a) and (b) are served, the Secretary shall, after the expiration of 7 days from the service of those documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: forthwith issue to the members who are in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the notice under subsection (1) which makes that request;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the decision to which that request relates; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a copy of any written representations made under subsection (3) in respect of that request;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after consultation with the members appointed under section 16(2)(c) who are in Hong Kong, fix a date and time for a meeting to review the decision to which that request relates which shall be not later than 21 days after the issue of the documents concerned under paragraph (a); but if, after that consultation, in the opinion of the Secretary, it is not practicable for him to fix a date and time within that period, he may fix a date and time not later than 35 days after the issue of those documents; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: after a date and time is fixed under paragraph (b) for a meeting to review the decision to which that request relates, forthwith by notice in writing served personally or by registered post—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: require that person (other than in the case of a person referred to in subsection (12)(f) or a request relating to the title of a film) to produce the relevant film (or a copy thereof), the packaging or advertising material; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: inform that person that he, or his authorized representative, or both, may attend before the Board on that date and time and, if so attending, shall be permitted to make representations;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on the Authority inform him that he, or his authorized representative, or both, may attend before the Board on that date and time and, if so attending, shall be permitted to make representations; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: on any other person whom the chairman of the Board considers to be a person who has an interest in the request or can assist the Board in the review of the decision to which the request relates, inform him that he, or his authorized representative, or both, may attend before the Board on that date and time and, if so attending, shall be permitted to make representations. (Replaced 74 of 1995 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (8), the Board shall at a meeting review the decision to which a request under subsection (1) relates by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except where the request relates to the title of a film, viewing the relevant film (or a copy thereof), or examining the packaging or advertising material to which the decision relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considering the documents concerned issued to it under subsection (4)(a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: considering the representations, if any, made in pursuance of subsection (4)(c),

subsection.continued: and thereafter, where appropriate, taking into consideration the matters referred to in section 10(2) and taking into account the matters referred to in section 10(3), shall complete the review by—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in relation to the decision, giving directions in writing to the Authority or a censor with respect to the exercise by him of any of his functions under this Ordinance, and the Authority or the censor, as the case may be, shall comply with any such directions; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in writing, refusing to give any such directions.

subsection.content: Where under subsection (5) the Board completes the review of the decision to which a request under subsection (1) relates, the Secretary shall forthwith serve either personally or by registered post on every concerned person a copy of the directions or refusal, as the case may be, given under subsection (5) in respect of that review.

Where at a meeting for the purpose of subsection (5) the Board does not complete the review of the decision to which a request under subsection (1) relates, the Board may complete the review at any subsequent meeting, and the review may be continued notwithstanding any change in the membership of the Board.

At a meeting for the purpose of subsection (5), 6 members shall form a quorum but if, after 30 minutes have elapsed since the time fixed for the meeting, less than 6 members are in attendance at the meeting, then 4 members shall form a quorum.

subsection.leadIn: Where, consequent upon a request under subsection (1), a person fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (4)(c)(i)(A) as specified in a notice served on him under subsection (4)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board may refuse to review the decision to which that request relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the Board refuses to review the decision, if the request relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the exhibition of a film and the failure was to produce the film (or a copy thereof), the relevant certificate of exemption or certificate of approval shall be deemed to be revoked;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the publication of a physical storage medium for films pursuant to approval under section 15A and the failure was to produce the storage medium, the relevant certificate of approval or certificate of exemption shall cease to operate as approval for publication under that section; (Amended 42 of 2021 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a certificate issued under section 15B(4)(b) and the failure was to produce the relevant packaging, the certificate shall be deemed to be revoked; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a certificate issued under section 15K(5) and the failure was to produce the relevant advertising material, the certificate shall be deemed to be revoked. (Replaced 74 of 1995 s. 21)

subsection.content: Where, consequent upon a request under subsection (1), a person complies with a requirement under subsection (4)(c)(i)(A) as specified in a notice served on him under subsection (4)(c), the Secretary shall, after that request is fully disposed of under this section, forthwith return to that person the film (or the copy thereof), packaging or advertising material, as the case may be, produced to the Secretary in accordance with that notice.

The Authority and a censor shall each have such powers as are necessary to give effect to any directions given to him under subsection (5)(i) by the Board, and such powers shall include, in the case of the Authority, the power to revoke a certificate issued under this Ordinance.

def.name: ConcernedPerson
def.leadIn: In this section concerned person (有關的人) means, where a request under subsection (1) relates to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the title of a film that is exhibited or published, the person to whom the relevant certificate of exemption or certificate of approval, as the case may be, was issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exhibition of a film, the person to whom the relevant certificate of exemption or certificate of approval, as the case may be, was issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the publication of a physical storage medium for films pursuant to section 15A, the person who has the right (by copyright licence, ownership of the copyright or any other right or licence) to distribute the storage medium; (Amended 42 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the publication or display of packaging, the person to whom the relevant certificate was issued under section 15B(4)(b);

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: any matter referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), any other person whom the chairman of the Board considers to be a person who has an interest in the request or can assist the Board in the review of the decision to which the request relates. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 21)

section.name: s19A
section.heading: Disapplication of sections 17, 18 and 19 for decisions made on grounds of national security

subsection.content: Sections 17, 18 and 19 do not apply in relation to a decision if the decision is based on an opinion that the exhibition of a film would be contrary to the interests of national security.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), it is immaterial—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the opinion mentioned in that subsection is the sole reason for the decision concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the decision concerned is a decision of the Authority—whether the decision is made for, or in connection with, the Authority’s exercise of a function under Division 2 of Part IV.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Offence in relation to exhibition or publication of films classified for exhibition or publication only to persons who have attained the age of 18 years

subsection.content: A person shall not exhibit a film which has the classification referred to in section 12(1)(c) to a person under the age of 18 years.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a first or second conviction to a fine at level 5; and (Amended 63 of 1993 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a third or subsequent conviction to a fine at level 6. (Amended E.R. 6 of 2021)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A person shall not publish a physical storage medium for films, to which the classification described in section 12(1)(c) applies, to a person under the age of 18 years. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 11. Amended 42 of 2021 s. 2)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (2A) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and imprisonment for 3 years. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 11. Amended 42 of 2021 s. 18)

It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (2) that the person charged took all reasonable precautions during the exhibition of the film to which the charge relates to prevent the exhibition of the film to persons under the age of 18 years.

It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (2A) to prove that at the time the offence is alleged to have been committed, the person charged inspected an identity card or passport purporting to be the identity card or passport of the person under the age of 18 years and believed on reasonable grounds that such person was not under the age of 18 years. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 11)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Offence in relation to contravention of conditions endorsed on a certificate

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes, as regards the exhibition of a film or the publication of a physical storage medium for films, a condition or a requirement, as the case may be, endorsed on— (Amended 42 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption issued under section 9;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of approval issued under section 13; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a certificate issued under section 15B(4)(b), (Added 63 of 1993 s. 12)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 6 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (1) or (4) alleging the contravention of a condition referred to in section 9(2)(i) and (ii) or 13(1)(c), (4)(b)(iii)(C) or (4A) or a requirement made under section 15B(4) or (6) as the case may be that the person charged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: did not know that the film or packaging, as the case may be, to which the charge relates did not comply with that condition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made such inquiries as were reasonable in his circumstances to ascertain whether that film or packaging, as the case may be, complied with that condition.

subsection.leadIn: A person to whom a certificate of exemption is issued under section 9, or a certificate of approval is issued under section 13, in respect of a film who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides the film to another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: knows that the film so provided—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is intended for exhibition or in the case of a physical storage medium for films, for publication, whether by the person so provided with the film or any other person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not comply with a condition referred to in section 9(2)(i) and (ii) or 13(1)(c) or (4)(b)(iii)(C) endorsed on the certificate,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 6 of 2021)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3B), where there is a certificate of approval or a certificate of exemption in force in respect of a film a person who possesses for the purpose of publication, a physical storage medium for films being such a storage medium with additions to or excisions from the form in which it was approved or exempted under this Ordinance, or with both such additions and excisions, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 22)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3A) shall not apply where the certificate of approval or certificate of exemption referred to in those subsections was issued pursuant to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a submission under section 8, and there is another certificate of approval or certificate of exemption in force in respect of that film issued pursuant to a submission under section 15AA(1) and the relevant physical storage medium for films is in the form in which it was exempted or approved pursuant to the second-mentioned submission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a submission under section 15AA(1), and there is another certificate of approval or certificate of exemption issued in respect of that film pursuant to a submission under section 8 and the relevant physical storage medium for films is in the form in which it was approved or exempted pursuant to the second-mentioned submission. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 22)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3A) a person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be deemed to possess a physical storage medium for films for publication if he possesses it with the intention of manufacturing or reproducing a copy of it for publication; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be presumed, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to possess a physical storage medium for films for publication if he is in possession of more than 2 copies of the storage medium in circumstances that give rise to a reasonable suspicion that he intends to publish it. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 22)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes a condition imposed under section 13(4A) or 15B(6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 12. Amended E.R. 6 of 2021)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Offence in relation to revocation, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not exhibit a film in respect of which a certificate of exemption issued under section 9 has been revoked or is deemed to be revoked under this Ordinance unless and until there is in force in respect of the film—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a further certificate of exemption issued under section 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of approval issued under section 13.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not exhibit a film in respect of which a certificate of approval issued under section 13 has been revoked or is deemed to be revoked under this Ordinance unless and until there is in force in respect of the film—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption issued under section 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a further certificate of approval issued under section 13.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and imprisonment for 3 years. (Amended 63 of 1993 s. 13; 74 of 1995 s. 23; 42 of 2021 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of approval issued in respect of a film under section 13; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption issued in respect of a film under section 9,

subsection.continued: has been revoked or deemed to be revoked under this Ordinance, a person shall not, subject to subsection (5), publish a physical storage medium for films containing a record of the visual images (or soundtrack associated with them) contained in the film to which the certificate relates or which is a copy of such a record contained in a physical storage medium for films to which the certificate relates, unless a further certificate of approval or a certificate of exemption, as the case may be, is issued in respect of the film concerned under the relevant section. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 13. Amended 42 of 2021 s. 2)

subsection.content: The prohibition against publication in subsection (4) shall not apply in relation to any publication during the period of 7 days beginning on the date a notice is first published under section 15I(2). (Added 63 of 1993 s. 13)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5B), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate issued under section 15B(4)(b) is revoked or deemed to be revoked; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate issued under section 15K(5) is revoked or deemed to be revoked,

subsection.continued: a person shall not, in the case referred to in—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: paragraph (a), publish a physical storage medium for films to which the classification described in section 12(1)(c) applies in packaging to which the relevant certificate related or display (with or without a physical storage medium for films) that part of the packaging constituting the cover of such a storage medium; and (Amended 42 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: paragraph (b), display to the public or publish any advertising material to which the relevant certificate related. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 23)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The prohibition in subsection (5A) shall not apply in relation to any publication or display during the period of 7 days beginning on the date the relevant notice is given under section 15B(9) or 15K(12), as the case may be. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 23)

A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and imprisonment for 3 years. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 13. Amended 74 of 1995 s. 23; 42 of 2021 s. 20)

A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (5A) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and imprisonment for 3 years. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 23. Amended 42 of 2021 s. 20)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Inspection and enforcement

subsection.content: The Authority may authorize in writing any public officer to be an inspector for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3A), an inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at all reasonable times enter any place in which he has reason to believe a film is exhibited or intended to be exhibited or a physical storage medium for films is published or intended to be published; (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 24; 42 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time enter any place in which he has reason to believe that an offence under this Ordinance is being or has been committed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in any place entered under paragraph (a) or (b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: seize a film, packaging or advertising material which appears to him to be evidence of an offence under this Ordinance; (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 24)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: require any person found in that place to furnish to him for his inspection, his proof of identity or a copy or a purported copy of a certificate issued under section 15B(4)(b) or 15K(5); and (Amended 63 of 1993 s. 14; 74 of 1995 s. 24)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: require any person found in that place to furnish to him his residential address or business address (if any), or both, and the telephone number of his residence or the telephone number of his place of business (if any) or both. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 24)

subsection.content: An inspector shall, if requested by any person in any place entered under subsection (2)(a) or (b), produce his authority as such inspector.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3C), an inspector shall not under subsection (2) enter and search any place unless a magistrate has issued a warrant under subsection (3B). (Added 63 of 1993 s. 14. Amended 42 of 2021 s. 21)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: A magistrate may, if he is satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for suspecting that there is on any place any film which may be seized under subsection (2), issue a warrant authorizing an inspector to enter and search the place. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 14. Amended 42 of 2021 s. 21)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: An inspector may under subsection (2) enter and search any place without warrant if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the delay necessary to obtain a warrant is likely to result in the loss or destruction of evidence of an offence under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other reason it would not be reasonably practicable to obtain a warrant in the circumstances of the case. (Added 42 of 2021 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs an inspector in the exercise of a power under subsection (2); (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails without reasonable excuse to furnish his proof of identity or a copy or purported copy of the certificate issued under section 15B(4)(b) or 15K(5), as the case may be, if so required under subsection (2)(c)(ii); or (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 24)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails without reasonable excuse to furnish an address or a telephone number required to be furnished under subsection (2)(c)(iii), (Added 74 of 1995 s. 24)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 63 of 1993 s. 14; E.R. 6 of 2021)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Censorship mark

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice in the Gazette, adopt, and, in his discretion, by notice in the Gazette, change or amend a censorship mark and such censorship mark shall be evidence that a film in connection with which it is displayed has been approved for exhibition or publication under this Ordinance.

A person who displays the censorship mark adopted under subsection (1), including the censorship mark as changed or amended under that subsection, or a mark calculated to be mistaken for the censorship mark, in connection with a film without the written consent of the Authority commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 6 of 2021)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Authority may issue replacement certificates

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority is satisfied that a certificate issued under a provision of this Ordinance to a person has been destroyed, lost or stolen, he may, upon application in such form as the Authority may determine by that person, issue to that person a further certificate in like terms and, where any such further certificate is so issued, it shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, be deemed— (Amended 9 of 1999 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be issued under that provision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be the certificate which the Authority is satisfied has been destroyed, lost or stolen.

subsection.content: A prescribed fee shall be payable for a certificate issued under this section, and no such certificate shall be so issued unless the fee for such certificate has been paid.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Proof of certain matters
section.leadIn: A document purporting to be under the hand of the Authority stating that a certificate attached to the document is a copy of a certificate issued under this Ordinance in respect of a film, packaging or advertising material described in that document shall in any proceedings be admitted in evidence on its production without further proof, and until the contrary is proved it shall be presumed that— (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who signed that document was the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate attached to that document is a true copy of the certificate issued under this Ordinance in respect of the film, packaging or advertising material, as the case may be, described in that document; and (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 25)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters contained in the certificate attached to that document are true.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Risk and expense relating to submission of film

subsection.content: The submission or production of a film under section 8(1), 15AA(1), 17(2)(c)(i), 18(3)(c)(i) or 19(4)(c)(i) or the submission of packaging under section 15B(1) or advertising material under section 15K and the possession by the Authority of a film, packaging or advertising material, as the case may be, resulting from such submission or production, shall be at the risk and expense of the person so submitting or producing any such film, packaging or advertising material, as the case may be. (Amended 63 of 1993 s. 16; 74 of 1995 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: The—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: deposit of pieces of excised film under section 14(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: retention of pieces of excised film under section 14(2),

subsection.continued: shall be at the risk and expense of the person who submitted the film under section 8.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Delegation of powers

subsection.content: Any public officer appointed by the Authority for the purposes of this section may exercise any of the functions which the Authority may exercise under this Ordinance except the function under section 6(2). (Amended 63 of 1993 s. 17)

section.name: s29
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may by regulation provide for— (Amended L.N. 372 of 1996; L.N. 192 of 1998; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment of allowances to advisers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in, and the place at, which a film is to be submitted under section 8 or packaging is to be submitted under section 15B(1) or advertising material is to be submitted under section 15K; (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 27)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the classes or descriptions of films that are suitable to be exempted under section 9;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the symbols designating the classifications of a film under section 12;

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: the matters relating to a repository established under section 29A, including the period for which any material in such repository is to be kept, the persons who are eligible to view, inspect or otherwise have access to such material, the procedure for viewing or inspecting any such material and the conditions (if any) subject to which it is to be viewed or inspected; (Added 63 of 1993 s. 18. Amended 74 of 1995 s. 27)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the manner in, and the place at, which a request under section 17, 18 or 19 is to be delivered to the Secretary; (Amended 9 of 1999 s. 12)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the service of any document;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: any period to be prescribed under this Ordinance. (Added 9 of 1999 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for— (Amended 55 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fee payable under section 9(5) or 10(8);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any fee for the purposes of section 15B(3); (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 27)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any fee payable under section 15K(4); (Replaced 74 of 1995 s. 27)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fee payable under section 25(2);

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: any fee (which may be different for different purposes) payable under section 29A(2); (Added 74 of 1995 s. 27)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the remission of any fee payable under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the better carrying into effect of this Ordinance except as regards matters under which regulations may be made under subsection (1). (Added 63 of 1993 s. 18)

subsection.content: Any regulations made under subsection (1A)(a) may provide for a fee to be fixed at a level which provides for the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred in the exercise of any functions under this Ordinance and shall not be limited by reference to the amount of any administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in the exercise of any particular function.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide— (Amended 55 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the contravention of any regulation made under subsection (1) or (2) or any specified provision of such regulation is an offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of such offence, a penalty not exceeding a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Replaced 63 of 1993 s. 18. Amended E.R. 6 of 2021)

section.name: s29A
section.heading: Authority to maintain repository

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall maintain a repository of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: physical storage medium for films deposited under section 9(3A) or 13(4C); (Amended 9 of 1999 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: packaging submitted under section 15B(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: physical storage medium for films deposited under section 15G; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: advertising material submitted under section 15K.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, subject to regulations made under section 29(1)(ha), on the payment of the appropriate prescribed fee, view or inspect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a physical storage medium for films in a repository referred to in subsection (1), which is or purports to be a copy of a published physical storage medium for films or a film which has been exhibited, for the purpose of comparing the copy or purported copy with the published or exhibited version;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a physical storage medium for films in such a repository to ascertain the conditions, if any, relating to publication; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: packaging or advertising material in such a repository.

section.name: s29B
section.heading: Power of Authority to set forms

subsection.content: The Authority may set the forms to be determined by him or that are required for the purposes of this Ordinance.
The Authority’s power under subsection (1) is subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form to comply with the requirement.

The Authority may include in a form a statutory declaration to be made by the person completing the form confirming that the particulars contained in the form are correct to the best of the person’s knowledge.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Guidelines for censors
section.content: The Secretary may, for information, from time to time cause to be prepared and published in the Gazette, for the guidance of censors, guidelines not inconsistent with this Ordinance, indicating the manner in which it is proposed that censors exercise their functions under this Ordinance.

section.name: s31
section.heading: No liability in the case of the bona fide exercise of functions under this Ordinance
section.content: No liability shall be incurred by any public officer in respect of anything done or omitted to be done by him bona fide in the exercise or purported exercise of any of his functions under this Ordinance.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Transitional

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, where any film or matter has been submitted or delivered under regulation 3 or 8 of the revoked regulations at any time before the commencement* of this Ordinance, then the provisions of the Film Censorship Regulations (Cap. 172 sub. leg., 1987 Ed.), as in force immediately before that commencement, shall apply to such film or matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the same manner as they applied to such film or matter immediately before that commencement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1), at any time on and from the commencement of this Ordinance, any film referred to in that subsection may be submitted under section 8(1) and, where any such film is so submitted, on and from the date of such submission, the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to such film so submitted as if such film so submitted had not been submitted under regulation 3 of the revoked regulations.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Any certificate of approval in force in respect of a film or matter submitted under the revoked regulations immediately before the expiry of the period of 12 months beginning on the date of commencement** of the Film Censorship (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (63 of 1993), shall expire on the expiry of such period. (Added 63 of 1993 s. 19)

def.name: RevokedRegulations
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, revoked regulations (經撤銷的規例) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Film Censorship Regulations (Cap. 172 sub. leg., 1984 Ed.) as in force at any time before 5 June 1987; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Film Censorship Regulations (Cap. 172 sub. leg., 1987 Ed.) as in force at any time before the commencement of this Ordinance.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Saving of existing regulations

subsection.content: Any regulation made under any provision repealed or amended by the Film Censorship (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (63 of 1993) (the amending Ordinance) and in force immediately before the commencement* of that Ordinance shall continue in force and have effect as if made under this Ordinance by the authority who, having regard to the subject-matter of such regulation, is empowered on or after the commencement of the amending Ordinance to make such regulation, and may be amended or repealed by such authority. (Amended 74 of 1995 s. 29)

Any repository maintained by the Authority immediately before the commencement** of the Film Censorship (Amendment) Ordinance 1995 (74 of 1995) (the amending Ordinance of 1995) under a provision repealed by that Ordinance shall continue to exist notwithstanding such repeal and be deemed to be a repository maintained under section 29A. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 29)

Any regulation made under a provision repealed or amended by section 27(a)(iii) or (b) of the amending Ordinance of 1995 and in force immediately before the commencement of that Ordinance shall continue to be in force notwithstanding such amendment or repeal and be deemed to have been made under this Ordinance as amended by the amending Ordinance of 1995. (Added 74 of 1995 s. 29)
